channel.title: Music
channel.description: NPR Music features, streams, live concerts and music news.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: South By South Africa: 5 Jazz Acts From The Rainbow Nation
item.description: For centuries, the country turned its back on black musicians — including the jazz artists whose creations embodied freedom and empowerment. Today, the Cape Town International Jazz Festival is one of Africa's largest musical gatherings. Here are five musicians who played the festival this year.
item.content:encoded:
For centuries, the country turned its back on black musicians — including the jazz artists whose creations embodied freedom and empowerment. Today, the Cape Town International Jazz Festival is one of Africa's largest musical gatherings. Here are five musicians who played the festival this year.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Caroline Shaw, 30, Wins Pulitzer For Music
item.description: The versatile composer, violinist and vocalist is one of just a handful of female musicians to earn the prize — and, at age 30, the youngest music winner ever. Her 'Partita for 8 Voices' was written for the debut recording by the vocal ensemble with which she performs, Roomful of Teeth.
item.content:encoded:
The versatile composer, violinist and vocalist is one of just a handful of female musicians to earn the prize — and, at age 30, the youngest music winner ever. Her 'Partita for 8 Voices' was written for the debut recording by the vocal ensemble with which she performs, Roomful of Teeth.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Dumbfoundead: A Rising Star In A Genre In Transition
item.description: Despite the prominence of Asian artists in several aspects of hip-hop, they're still not the most visible performers in the genre. Dumbfoundead wants to be an exception.
item.content:encoded:
Despite the prominence of Asian artists in several aspects of hip-hop, they're still not the most visible performers in the genre. Dumbfoundead wants to be an exception.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Local Natives On World Cafe
item.description: The indie-rock group from LA plays songs from its latest release, Hummingbird, and talks about recording the sun-drenched album.
item.content:encoded:
The indie-rock group from LA plays songs from its latest release, Hummingbird, and talks about recording the sun-drenched album.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Next: Escondido
item.description: Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros' Tyler James and fashion designer Jessica Maros met in 2011 and bonded over a mutual love of Ennio Morricone's spaghetti Western soundtracks. Hear two tracks from the duo's debut album, The Ghost of Escondido, which was recorded live in one day.
item.content:encoded:
Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros' Tyler James and fashion designer Jessica Maros met in 2011 and bonded over a mutual love of Ennio Morricone's spaghetti Western soundtracks. Hear two tracks from the duo's debut album, The Ghost of Escondido, which was recorded live in one day.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Nick Cave And The Bad Seeds, Live In Concert: SXSW 2013
item.description: Sinewy and powerful as ever, and backed by his longtime band, Nick Cave works the crowd like a revival preacher at half-speed during a career-spanning set at NPR Music's SXSW showcase at Stubb's in Austin, Texas. Watch Cave perform "Jubilee Street," "From Her to Eternity" and "Push the Sky Away," and hear audio of his full set.
item.content:encoded:
Sinewy and powerful as ever, and backed by his longtime band, Nick Cave works the crowd like a revival preacher at half-speed during a career-spanning set at NPR Music's SXSW showcase at Stubb's in Austin, Texas. Watch Cave perform "Jubilee Street," "From Her to Eternity" and "Push the Sky Away," and hear audio of his full set.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Yo La Tengo: Tiny Desk Concert
item.description: Yo La Tengo's sound has evolved quite a bit since Georgia Hubley and Ira Kaplan first jammed together in 1984; the feedback has subsided, replaced by a more contemplative vibe. To coincide with the release of the band's 13th album, Fade, Yo La Tengo performs an acoustic set behind Bob Boilen's desk.
item.content:encoded:
Yo La Tengo's sound has evolved quite a bit since Georgia Hubley and Ira Kaplan first jammed together in 1984; the feedback has subsided, replaced by a more contemplative vibe. To coincide with the release of the band's 13th album, Fade, Yo La Tengo performs an acoustic set behind Bob Boilen's desk.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Kathy Mattea On Mountain Stage
item.description: Making her 16th appearance on Mountain Stage, the singer-songwriter plays selections from her latest album, Calling Me Home, which examines her native Appalachia.
item.content:encoded:
Making her 16th appearance on Mountain Stage, the singer-songwriter plays selections from her latest album, Calling Me Home, which examines her native Appalachia.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Emeli Sande's 'Version Of Events'
item.description: Scottish musician Emeli Sande's debut album is titled Our Version of Events. It sold more copies than any other album in the U.K. last year, and is now a hit in the U.S. In this special encore presentation, Emeli Sande performs for host Michel Martin and chats about her whirlwind success.
item.content:encoded:
Scottish musician Emeli Sande's debut album is titled Our Version of Events. It sold more copies than any other album in the U.K. last year, and is now a hit in the U.S. In this special encore presentation, Emeli Sande performs for host Michel Martin and chats about her whirlwind success.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Maria Callas On The Move: A Diva Does D.C.
item.description: After a week on the town, with visits to the White House, the Opera House and Ben's Chili Bowl, NPR Music's Diva-in-Residence (and cardboard cut-out) makes her way to our brand-new headquarters.
item.content:encoded:
After a week on the town, with visits to the White House, the Opera House and Ben's Chili Bowl, NPR Music's Diva-in-Residence (and cardboard cut-out) makes her way to our brand-new headquarters.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Tall Glass Of Rock Star-Ness: A Q&A With Questlove
item.description: Questlove, drummer and co-founder of The Roots, is coming out with a memoir in June called Mo' Meta Blues, co-written with Ben Greenman. The musician spoke with NPR intern Lidia Jean Kott about why the movie Spring Breakers made him feel like less of a rock star, and whether you can ever outgrow being a dweeb.
item.content:encoded:
Questlove, drummer and co-founder of The Roots, is coming out with a memoir in June called Mo' Meta Blues, co-written with Ben Greenman. The musician spoke with NPR intern Lidia Jean Kott about why the movie Spring Breakers made him feel like less of a rock star, and whether you can ever outgrow being a dweeb.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Heavy Rotation: 10 Songs Public Radio Can't Stop Playing
item.description: Download new music from hip-hop veteran N.O.R.E., indie-rock favorites Telekinesis and Phosphorescent, soul man Charles Bradley, folksinger Samantha Crain and many more in this special edition of Heavy Rotation.
item.content:encoded:
Download new music from hip-hop veteran N.O.R.E., indie-rock favorites Telekinesis and Phosphorescent, soul man Charles Bradley, folksinger Samantha Crain and many more in this special edition of Heavy Rotation.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Remembering Colin Davis, A Conductor Beloved Late In Life
item.description: The English conductor was knighted in 1980 and won three Grammys — but did not reach the real heights of his career until he was in his sixties and seventies. Famed for his interpretations of Berlioz, Sibelius and Mozart as well as contemporary composers, he died at age 85 on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
The English conductor was knighted in 1980 and won three Grammys — but did not reach the real heights of his career until he was in his sixties and seventies. Famed for his interpretations of Berlioz, Sibelius and Mozart as well as contemporary composers, he died at age 85 on Sunday.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: Brass Bed, 'The Secret Will Keep You'
item.description: A sad parade of loneliness, death, fear and madness comes to life on an oddly buoyant album. Brass Bed's dark themes are wrapped in sunny melodies and mysterious synth sounds that ultimately dissolve into glorious chaos. It's part sonic exploration, part infectious pop and part noise rock.
item.content:encoded:
A sad parade of loneliness, death, fear and madness comes to life on an oddly buoyant album. Brass Bed's dark themes are wrapped in sunny melodies and mysterious synth sounds that ultimately dissolve into glorious chaos. It's part sonic exploration, part infectious pop and part noise rock.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: Steve Martin And Edie Brickell, 'Love Has Come For You'
item.description: With assists from fellow stars such as Esperanza Spalding and Sara and Sean Watkins of Nickel Creek, Martin's banjo lines sing and sway with grace and charm that seem effortless. Edie Brickell's plainspoken warmth pairs wonderfully with Martin's playful picking throughout.
item.content:encoded:
With assists from fellow stars such as Esperanza Spalding and Sara and Sean Watkins of Nickel Creek, Martin's banjo lines sing and sway with grace and charm that seem effortless. Edie Brickell's plainspoken warmth pairs wonderfully with Martin's playful picking throughout.
